venue.name: College of the Atlantic - McCormick Lecture Hall (Gates Community Center)

item.description:
Join Lisa Fernandes of the The Resilience Hub and the Eat Local Food Coalition of Maine to learn about permaculture as a systems design method that can support the creation of resilient food systems at various scales.  This talk will explore the underlying design ethics and principles behind permaculture and will show examples of how the principles are being applied in our bioregion.  Finally, we will discuss how this type of design thinking can lead to food systems that have the resilience and stability of healthy ecosystems.

This lecture is part of the Human Ecology Forums held at College of the Atlantic in Bar Harbor Maine and will be posted on their web site soon.

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: Permaculture & Designing Resilient Food Systems (in Bar Harbor)
